[h1] A simple, short puzzle game with a surprisingly fun mechanic [/h1] 

[b] What is a portal? [/b]
[url=en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal_(video_game)#/media/File:Portal_physics-2.svg] You have two portals. You walk through the one on the left, and you come out of the one on the right. That's the easiest way to describe it. [/url]

[b] Spec requirements/graphics [/b] 
Try to have something released after 2004, please.
Easy to run. If your performance struggles on the lowest settings, you can lower the render distance for the portals.

For being set entirely within white tiled rooms, it looks nice.

[b] Difficulty [/b]
It's a puzzle game, so you'll need to do some thinking and have fast reaction time towards the end of the game. There's a set of levels after you beat the game that offer more challenge.

[b] Story [/b]
You can beat this game in less than an hour, so the story isn't long. It's enjoyable though.

[b] So, overall? [/b]
It's short. So short you could beat it in 40 minutes. If you want more after playing, buy the sequel.

Not only is this a 13 year old game that feels like it could have been made yesterday, it is probably the most enjoyable 3D puzzle game ever. I seldom gel with 3D puzzle games as they tend to get something wrong, either the pacing, the controls, or simply the fundamental flaw of having puzzles that don't specifically need to be in a three-dimensional game.

This, on the other hand, is a game that – due to its unique portal game mechanic – simply HAS to be in three dimensions, starting off as a relatively light game with a steep progression towards the end, the last few levels taking a lot longer and requiring all the skills you have learnt as you were gradually and reasonably quickly eased through the first part of the game.

While you are completing the levels, you are also treated to the amazing AI voiceover of your test controller. The monologue is perfectly written and timed for maximum entertainment value. Also, one should not switch off the game right away when you win as the song at the end is important to listen to as well, and – again – it is writing perfection.

I was quite happy to play through the main game for now, but if I feel the need to revisit this, there are bonus levels that provide new challenges, also with what is now a pretty standard rating system for puzzle games to evaluate your performance.

I didn't play this 13 years ago, and I bought it on sale a few years ago, but once I got to it, I can see what all the fuss was about when it was released: it is simply one of the best puzzle games ever, and would also list highly on any good list of the best games, whether it be by decade, century or ever.

It is a testament to the quality of this game that more than 50% of all players who have bought it on Steam have actually played it all the way through.
Good puzzles that require proper brainstorming to figure out. Great game, 8/10.

Excelente juego, los puzzles no son muy difíciles pero algunos si te dejan pensando un rato, la mecánica de los portales es interesante. El único punto negativo es que es bastante corto, también incluye Niveles Avanzados y Desafíos para aumentar un poco la duración del titulo pero no dejan de ser prácticamente reciclaje de los niveles de la campaña con alguna ligera modificación.
